meanings.sent1: She was flanneling the baby to keep him warm.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was flanneling the inside of the coat for extra comfort.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried flanneling itself with a small piece of fabric, thinking it was a blanket.
meanings.sent4: The fog flanneled the town, wrapping it in a soft, gray embrace.
meanings.sent5: The cozy cabin was flanneled with warm blankets, creating a snug atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To act or speak evasively or misleadingly.
meanings.sent1: He was flanneling his way out of answering the tough questions.
meanings.sent2: Politicians are known for flanneling when they don't want to give a direct answer.
meanings.sent3: The child tried flanneling about eating the last cookie, but the crumbs on his face gave him away.
meanings.sent4: Her words flanneled around the truth, leaving everyone unsure of what really happened.
meanings.sent5: The detective saw through the suspect's flanneling and uncovered the real story.

meanings.definition: To rub or clean with flannel.
meanings.sent1: She was flanneling the silverware to make it shine for the dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The maid was flanneling the windows to remove any smudges.
meanings.sent3: The car wash attendant was flanneling the vehicles with care, ensuring they sparkled in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The old man flanneled his glasses, polishing them until they gleamed.
meanings.sent5: The mother flanneled her child's face after a messy meal, wiping away all traces of food.
